intro: Loasa laciniata, commonly known as the redstem loasa, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, often reddish stems and heart-shaped leaves with a rough, serrated edge. Its showy, pink to purple flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Loasa laciniata is typically found in wetlands, swamps, and along stream banks, where it thrives in moist, rich soil conditions.
